description:
APQuest is a minimal 8bit-era inspired adventure game with grid-like movement.
Good games don't need more than six checks.

v0.1.0.description:
This is the first playable build for Crash 2 (PAL)
There are currently no customization options beyond the default template
The randomization logic assumes you are able to perform speed-run skips (i.e. red gem early, road to ruin box gem early, ruination green gem path without green gem)

**Checks:**

- All 25 crystals
- All 42 clear/colored gems
- All 27 level exits + 5 secret exits
- All bosses (excluding Cortex)

**Item Pool:**

- 25 crystals (used to unlock the next warp room / boss)
- 37 clear gems (does nothing)
- 5 colored gems (used to unlock colored gem platforms)
- lives (filler item)

**Goal:**

- Defeat Dr. Neo Cortex

**Features:**

- View your item inventory with the in-game pause menu
- Completed crystal/gem checks show up in the warp room
- Connecting syncs your progress, so if the game crashes you can always start a new save, re-open the client, and connect

**Known Issues:**

- Re-opening the client and connecting to a game that was connected crashes the game
- Connecting, then loading a state where the game wasn't connected, and then reconnecting crashes the game
v0.1.0.title: v0.1.0

v0.1.1.description:
Note: When playing make sure DuckStation is on Interpreter mode

## Changes:

**Bug Fixes:**
- Game should now never crash when clicking connect in the client
- Fixed logic so that it acknowledges locked secret entrances
- There are definitely no bugs introduced in this release*

There are now options!

**Options:**
- Toggle level exit checks
- Add extra crystals to the item pool
- Toggle if speedrun skips are in logic
- Chance for filler lives to instead be a single wumpa fruit

**New Checks:**
- Warp room polar lives secret

**New Items:**
- Singular wumpa fruit


**Known Issues:**
- The version of Archipelago Core that this release uses can rarely desync and delete a received item

Also I updated the readme so that it has the correct game and instructions

(*until you find them, that is)
v0.1.1.title: Release v0.1.1

v0.2.0.description:
Note: When playing make sure DuckStation is on Interpreter mode

## Changes:
**Bug Fixes:**
- This release was updated to use different version of AP core to fix the game-state from rarely de-syncing 
- Fixed a lot of bugs found in v0.2.0-pre

**New Checks:**
- Option to enable wumpa fruit checks (a.k.a. fruit sanity)
  - Can choose to make each individual wumpa fruit a check, or to have wumpa fruit "bundles" to reduce check spam
  - Adds a total of 2393 wumpa checks, or 404 bundle checks
  - Wumpas found inside of crates are not counted

**Known Issues:**
- Nothing :)
  - Well technically reconnecting on a new save will not give you back opened secret entrances and credit for defeating specifically Komodo Bros, but who asked
v0.2.0.title: Release v0.2.0

v0.2.0-pre.description:
Note: the fruit sanity option is meant for demo purposes only

## Changes:

**Bug Fixes:**
- This release was updated to use different version of AP core to fix the Gamestate from rarely de-syncing (probably)
  - This potentially broke some things since I re-worked a lot of the item/location code

**New Checks:**
- Option to enable wumpa fruit checks (a.k.a. fruit sanity)
  - Can choose to make each wumpa fruit a check, or to have wumpa fruit "bundles" to reduce check spam
  - This pre release **ONLY** adds wumpa checks to the first warp room

**Known Issues:**
- Individual wumpa checks show up with broken names in the client
- Because fruit sanity currently only applies to the first 5 levels, the concentration of items is very front heavy
- Connecting doesn't sync already found locations, which it does in v0.1.1
v0.2.0-pre.title: v0.2.0 Pre-Release
